metadata.title: CVE-2017-3651 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server component of Oracle MySQL (subcomponent:Client mysqldump). Supported versions that are affected are 5.5.56 andearlier, 5.6.36 and earlier and 5.7.18 and earlier. Easily exploitablevulnerability allows low privileged attacker with network access viamultiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of thisvulnerability can result in unauthorized update, insert or delete access tosome of MySQL Server accessible data. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 4.3 (Integrityimpacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-3651` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient18 - 5.5.57-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libmysqld-pic - 5.5.57-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-client - 5.5.57-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-client-5.5 - 5.5.57-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.5 - 5.5.57-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-common - 5.5.57-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server - 5.5.57-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server-5.5 - 5.5.57-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.5 - 5.5.57-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-source-5.5 - 5.5.57-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.5.57-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.5 - 5.5.57-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

libmariadbclient18 - 5.5.53-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-client - 5.5.53-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-client-5.5 - 5.5.53-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-client-core-5.5 - 5.5.53-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-common - 5.5.53-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-server - 5.5.53-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-server-5.5 - 5.5.53-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-server-core-5.5 - 5.5.53-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-test - 5.5.53-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-test-5.5 - 5.5.53-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.57-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
mysql-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
mariadb-5.5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.53-1ubuntu0.14.04.1').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
